Title.evidence: Title: Randomised Controlled Trial of Structured Exercise in ERAS Protocols

Trial_Design.evidence: Randomisation methods and allocation concealment were not specified.

Participants.evidence: Eligibility criteria encompassed studies reporting on postoperative complications, length of hospital stay (LOS), and overall recovery.

Intervention.evidence: Structured exercise interventions, including aerobic activities and resistance training, were linked to reduced postoperative complications and shorter hospital stays.

Objective.evidence: This study assesses the role of structured exercise within the Enhanced Recovery After Surgery (ERAS) protocol in improving postoperative outcomes.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was LOS reduction, measured immediately post-surgery.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation methods and allocation concealment were not specified.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The effect size for LOS reduction was a mean difference of 1.5 days (95% CI 1.0 to 2.0; p < 0.001).

Trial_Registration.evidence: Trial registration and funding details were not provided.

Funding.evidence: Trial registration and funding details were not provided.
